messages.content: 9-1-1, where's your emergency?
Well, I'm on 41 going south. I just crossed Chamberlain, and a man pulled up next to me. There was a child screaming in his car.
What kind of vehicle is it?
It's a blue Camaro, like from the 90s or early 2000s or something.
Was it a baby or a child?

No, it was a child. It's dark, but I turned to look. The driver is a white male, light-colored hair, sort of plump. He's behind me now. I tried to slow down so he could pass me and I could read his license plate.
Okay, ma'am, don't hang up, okay?
I'm not.
Where are you now?
I'm just crossing Jinx Drive. I'm going very slow, like 45 miles an hour on 41.
And he's behind you?
I think so. He hasn't passed me, and he's going slower than I am, which is odd because we're holding up traffic. I think he saw me looking at him. He's going even slower now.
Are you pulling over?
No, something's going on because he's going even slower now. Okay, he's pulling over to the other lane now.
Can you give me your name and cell phone number?
My name is Jane Kowalski, K-O-W-A-L-S-K-I. My cell phone number is 813-205-4100.
Oh shit, he's turning left on Toledo Blade. He's turning left right now.
He's turning left onto Toledo Blade, and you said it's a blue Camaro with a white male driver?
Yes, and there's a kid in the back seat banging on the window. The child looked between 5 and 10 years old, definitely not an infant.
About how old do you think the child is?
I'd say less than 10, maybe between 5 to 10 years old.
Okay, do you want to try to follow him?
I don't know if I can catch up. There's a lot of traffic and I can't get over. The child was screaming, like a 'get me out of here' scream.
Blue or black Camaro with a white male driver, light-colored hair. Got it. Thanks for calling this in.
I'm way past them now and I wouldn't be able to catch up. I didn't want to put myself at risk.
Alright, Jane. And you're driving a Silver Mercedes?
Yes, a Silver Mercedes 380.
Thank you. Are you in a safe place?
I just pulled over into the Toys 'R' Us parking lot at the Town Center Mall.
Okay, please stay there and keep your doors locked.
Okay, I'm in my car with the doors locked.
Thank you, Jane. We'll have someone follow up with you if needed.
Alright, thank you. I just wanted to make sure I called it in.
You did the right thing. Thank you for calling.
God, I hope everything turns out okay.
We have your number. If we need more information, we'll call you back. Thank you.
Alright, thank you. Bye.
